title: BBC News - Breaking news, video and the latest top stories from the U.S. and around the world
content: Skip to contentBritish Broadcasting CorporationHomeNewsSportBusinessInnovationCultureArtsTravelEarthAudioVideoLiveIsrael-Gaza WarWar in UkraineUS & CanadaUKAfricaAsiaAustraliaEuropeLatin AmericaMiddle EastIn PicturesBBC InDepthBBC VerifyNewsNewsLIVEGeneva talks with Ukraine 'most productive and meaningful' so far, Rubio says The US secretary of state adds that talks are ongoing, as Ukraine's lead delegate thanks Donald Trump for the support shown to his country.In Ukraine's 'kill-zone', robots are a lifeline to troops trapped on perilous eastern frontLand drones are increasingly the only means of transporting supplies to the embattled city of Pokrovsk.10 hrs agoEuropeFifty children escape after mass school abduction in NigeriaThe raid on a Christian school came amid a surge of attacks by armed groups in the African nation.1 hr agoAfricaMan who grabbed Ariana Grande at premiere banned from SingaporeThe actress and singer has not commented on the incident, but appeared visibly shaken by it.8 hrs agoAsia'We worry more about food' say Venezuelans living under threat of US military actionWhile the US escalates a military threat in nearby waters, Venezuelans say the real enemy of the people is a sharp rise in food prices.17 hrs agoLatin AmericaWho killed young Chechen woman who fled Russia for a life of freedom?Aishat Baimuradova fled her home this year in the hope of living the way she wanted, but she was then found dead in her rented flat.17 hrs agoEuropeA private jet and massive debt - the rise and fall of a £1m Glastonbury ticket scammerRipped-off customers are hunting for Miles Hart after he sold hundreds of Glastonbury tickets and vanished.11 hrs agoSomersetIsrael says it killed top Hezbollah official in first attack on Beirut in monthsIsrael has escalated its campaign on targets it says are linked to Hezbollah, raising fears of a resumption of hostilities.7 mins agoMiddle EastUkrainian refugee becomes sumo champion in JapanNavy intercepts two Russian ships in English ChannelVietnam floods leave at least 90 dead and 12 missingNasa astronaut films Northern Lights from spaceTitanic passenger's watch sells for record-breaking £1.78m at auctionMore to exploreEscalating war of words between Ethiopia and Eritrea triggers fears of conflictThe authorities in landlocked Ethiopia have ratcheted up rhetoric over access to an Eritrean port. 9 hrs agoAfrica'How ambitious was it?': BBC on the ground as COP30 endsThe COP30 climate summit fails to secure new pledges to cut fossil fuels after running over time for more than 18 hours.19 hrs agoHidden in plain sight - Mumbai's glorious Art Deco legacy at 100Mumbai is home to one of the world's largest collection of Art Deco buildings, but many are unprotected.15 hrs agoAsiaFarewell regular flat white. 'Functional' coffees are hitting the high streetCoffees made with extra ingredients like mushrooms, protein and collagen are known as "functional coffees".17 hrs agoBusinessOur babies were taken after 'biased' parenting test - now we're fighting to get them backThe Danish government has banned the use of parental competency tests on Greenlandic families after decades of criticism.6 hrs agoEuropeRupert Grint: 'I'll never step out of Ron Weasley's shadow'The actor told the BBC he's written a letter to the next child actor playing Ron in the upcoming HBO TV adaptation of the books.16 hrs agoCultureMove over fillers. Here's why people are having fish sperm facial injectionsCelebs including Charlie XCX swear by them. But what are polynucleotides and do they work?2 days agoMost watched1Nasa astronaut films Northern Lights from space2Nathan Gill gives 'no comment' interview after arrest3Watch: Nasa releases new images of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS4Pope Leo impresses crowd with 'great catch'5Watch: Pope Leo to US students: Don't let AI do your homeworkAlso in newsIrish fashion designer Paul Costelloe dies aged 80His family issued a statement on Saturday saying they are "deeply saddened to announce the passing of Paul Costelloe following a short illness".1 day agoEuropeIsraeli strikes across Gaza kill 22 Palestinians, medical and civil defence officials sayIsrael says it struck targets in Gaza after an "armed terrorist" crossed the so-called yellow line and fired at soldiers.21 hrs agoMiddle EastSeven arrested in India after police crack $800,000 bank heistArmed men posing as bank officials robbed a van transporting cash between bank branches in Bengaluru city.6 hrs agoAsiaSeven bodyguards arrested over Mexican mayor's murderCarlos Manzo, an outspoken critic of cartel violence, was gunned down in public on 1 November.1 day agoLatin AmericaHow Marjorie Taylor Greene went from Trump ally to quitting CongressGreene's tenure in Congress may be ending, but her involvement in US political life may not be over.24 hrs agoUS & CanadaDrones sightings halt air traffic near Dutch city of EindhovenIt is the latest in a series of drone sightings near airports and military bases in northern Europe.20
